Understanding The Dangers And Future Repercussions Of A Coma

A coma is a period of prolonged unconsciousness resulting from a serious head or brain injury. A coma can result from any accident that caused a serious head injury, including:

  • Motor vehicle accidents
  • Workplace accidents
  • Anesthesia errors

Sadly, many comas leave victims in a permanent vegetative state. Families are forced to make tough decisions for their loved ones.

Legal Help For The Injured

If a loved one is or was in a coma due to an injury caused by the suspected negligent actions of another, seeking out skilled and experienced legal guidance is invaluable.

An attorney can help you understand your options and can put forward the most effective case for securing the compensation that will be needed to cover the costs of long-term medical care or losses stemming from the death of your loved one.

Turning To Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our attorneys are dedicated to helping those who have a loved one in a coma or lost a loved one in an accident.

Our lawyers have more than 100 years of combined experience representing families throughout Columbus, Ohio, with personal injury matters and a track record for securing multimillion-dollar verdicts and settlements.

Super Lawyers, AV Preeminent Rating From Martindale-Hubbell

Attorney Timothy L. Van Eman has been selected for inclusion in the Ohio Super Lawyers listing and both Mr. Van Eman and Thomas W. Trimble have received AV Preeminent* ratings from Martindale-Hubbell.

Our team has worked with the loved ones of those who have fallen into comas after such seemingly mundane events as going in to have wisdom teeth removed.

Let Us Help Secure The Compensation You Need

We understand the challenges and decisions you face. We offer guidance during every stage of the process for you and your family.

Call today to set up a free consult to talk about your circumstances and legal options: 614-360-2706. Or you can simply contact us online. We collect attorneys’ fees only if we recover compensation for you.
